name: places/ChIJz9a4bCb2wokRdRJ0lZ-2eQA
adrFormatAddress: 2628 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text:
Needs improvement, but "assistant" was on the right track with what the problem was. I would not call this excellent care.

Hispanic guy working at the front desk could not allow me to be registered (for a repeat visit) even though I made it on time before closing.  "here for too many hours, i want to leave". The problem that was presenting itself was quite severe but these people could not understand that point.
Any medical professionals should warn a patient of the dangers with a drug resistant bacteria which can avoid antibiotics. But these are not experts.
When I tried again for a needed visit I was not able to get the benefit of the advice of  Mark the "PA", even though I was there in time and the payment would be made. Places like this can be very helpful if you need any testing done.

originalText.text: We’ve used this Urgent Care multiple times during the pandemic for Covid testing. Friendly staff at reception - and the nurses, too. Easy booking via the online system.

text.text: We’ve used this Urgent Care multiple times during the pandemic for Covid testing. Friendly staff at reception - and the nurses, too. Easy booking via the online system.

originalText.text:
We needed to confirm that the patient (diabetic) had pneumonia. The doctor made a misdiagnosis or an incomplete diagnosis. For exemple, there were no x-rays to confirm it. He did not test for sugar levels neither, knowing that the patient was asked for insulin, since the medication container was broken and needed some. Dr commented about patient's migratory statuts, why?
I can't haveZero doctor professionalism. Clinique to avoid if possible. Happens on Sunday November 13 at PM. Then, on Monday November 14, patient came back and the clinic (Mme Eva at the front desk, denied the consultation. Argument was, don't pay again 120 USD, then Eva talked to the Dr and (she) the Dr asked go to emergency. If I could give a minus 5 stars in this review, I'd do it .

originalText.text:
AVOID THIS URGENT CARE
went there to have a rapid covid test, only stayed for 5 minutes or less, didn't see any doctor/provider.a month later got a bill from them charging me $50.00 copay. called their billing department, and one person said yes, even i didn't see a doctor, it was still an office visit, and $50.00 copay for that visit. then called the insurance company and i was told that this provider billed the service as a regular urgent care visit not a covid test service, they used a wrong billing code. so i called urgent care's billing department again, and told them to use the correct code to bill for the covid test but they gave me a run around and nothing was fixed, so at the end, i got charged $50.00 on my credit card. i will definitely not going to use any Northwell Health urgent care service anymore.

originalText.text:
I rarely like to use urgent care but for Covid test , this place became my testing site. For the test doctor doesn’t need to see you or take your personal information, they charge from your insurance company. Tests are free but urgent care is not and if you have been checked by the doctor, depending on your copay, you’ll get the bill.
On my last Covid test, I did not even get the chance to let them know that that I don’t need to be seen by the doctor, she just came and I received the bill. When I called the insurance, they explained that from January even the Covid test falls in urgent care category which Northwell urgent care desk person doesn’t tell you.
Right outside their facility there is another testing site, so if you have heavy copayment, I would recommend to use another Covid test site.
